attributes.action: overturn the ridiculous rules imposed by the Ministry of Defence seeking to gag the Armed Forces from discussing defence matters in their spare time
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
DIN 2007 DIN 03-006 contains the Draconian provision:

"Members of the Armed Forces and MOD Civil Servants must seek prior permission from DGMC if they wish to communicate about defence via books, articles or academic papers; self-publish via a blog, podcast or other shared text, audio or video; take part in external questionnaires, polls, surveys or research projects, speak at conferences, private engagements or other events where the public or media may be present; or contribute to any online community or share information such as a bulletin board, wiki, online social network, or multi-player game."

It appears to be acceptable for the Armed Forces to risk their lives defending freedom, but not to practice it.  We call upon the Prime Minister to repeal this ridiculous diktat imposed by spin doctors and allow Armed Forces personnel the freedom they deserve.
attributes.creator_name: Flt Lt Iain Paton RAF Retd
